androidx.media.subtitle

Class SubtitleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.media.subtitle.SubtitleController

  • public class SubtitleController
extends java.lang.Object
    The subtitle controller provides the architecture to display subtitles for a media source. It allows specifying which tracks to display, on which anchor to display them, and also allows adding external, out-of-band subtitle tracks.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SubtitleController.Anchor
      Subtitle anchor, an object that is able to display a subtitle renderer, e.g.
      static class  SubtitleController.Renderer
      Interface for supporting a single or multiple subtitle types in MediaPlayer.

      • getTracks

        public SubtitleTrack[] getTracks()
        Returns:
        the available subtitle tracks for this media. These include the tracks found by MediaPlayer as well as any tracks added manually via addTrack(MediaFormat).

      • getSelectedTrack

        public SubtitleTrack getSelectedTrack()
        Returns:
        the currently selected subtitle track

      • selectTrack

        public boolean selectTrack(SubtitleTrack track)
        Selects a subtitle track. As a result, this track will receive in-band data from the MediaPlayer. However, this does not change the subtitle visibility. Should be called from the anchor's (UI) thread. #Anchor.getSubtitleLooper
        Parameters:
        track - The subtitle track to select. This must be one of the tracks in getTracks().
        Returns:
        true if the track was successfully selected.

      • getDefaultTrack

        public SubtitleTrack getDefaultTrack()
        Returns:
        the default subtitle track based on system preferences, or null, if no such track exists in this manager. Supports HLS-flags: AUTOSELECT, FORCED & DEFAULT. 1. If captioning is disabled, only consider FORCED tracks. Otherwise, consider all tracks, but prefer non-FORCED ones. 2. If user selected "Default" caption language: a. If there is a considered track with DEFAULT=yes, returns that track (favor the first one in the current language if there are more than one default tracks, or the first in general if none of them are in the current language). b. Otherwise, if there is a track with AUTOSELECT=yes in the current language, return that one. c. If there are no default tracks, and no autoselectable tracks in the current language, return null. 3. If there is a track with the caption language, select that one. Prefer the one with AUTOSELECT=no. The default values for these flags are DEFAULT=no, AUTOSELECT=yes and FORCED=no.

      • selectDefaultTrack

        public void selectDefaultTrack()
        should be called from anchor thread

      • reset

        public void reset()
        must be called from anchor thread

      • addTrack

        public SubtitleTrack addTrack(MediaFormat format)
        Adds a new, external subtitle track to the manager.
        Parameters:
        format - the format of the track that will include at least the MIME type MediaFormat@KEY_MIME.
        Returns:
        the created SubtitleTrack object

      • show

        public void show()
        Show the selected (or default) subtitle track. Should be called from the anchor's (UI) thread. #Anchor.getSubtitleLooper

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hide the selected (or default) subtitle track. Should be called from the anchor's (UI) thread. #Anchor.getSubtitleLooper

      • registerRenderer

        public void registerRenderer(SubtitleController.Renderer renderer)
        Add support for a subtitle format in MediaPlayer.
        Parameters:
        renderer - a SubtitleController.Renderer object that adds support for a subtitle format.

      • hasRendererFor

        public boolean hasRendererFor(MediaFormat format)
        Returns true if one of the registered renders supports given media format.
        Parameters:
        format - a MediaFormat object
        Returns:
        true if this SubtitleController has a renderer that supports the media format.

      • setAnchor

        public void setAnchor(SubtitleController.Anchor anchor)
        called from anchor's looper (if any, both when unsetting and setting)

Generated javadoc for the new package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK. Going forward, the android.* package hierarchy will be reserved for Android packages that ship with the operating system; other packages will be issued in the new androidx.* package hiearchy.
